form.label: Site ID
form.title: Site ID change
form.description: Here you can change your installation's site ID. Because a site ID must be unique, you are not allowed to enter a value but it will be automatically generated.
form.precon: GeoNetwork must be stopped because the SettingManager caches data. There are also some other operations that it is better to do with GeoNetwork stopped.

form.label: Jetty
form.title: Jetty parameters
form.description: If you are running GeoNetwork with the integrated Jetty server then you can use this panel to change some parameters, mainly the servlet name and port used to access GeoNetwork.
form.precon: Jetty must be restarted in order to make the changes effective.

form.label: DBMS
form.title: DBMS configuration
form.description: This panel allows you to change the DBMS you want to connect to. Here you change only the configuration. You have also to create the schema and populate the database. You can do that through the 'database/setup' panel.
form.precon: GeoNetwork must be restarted in order to make the changes effective.

form.label: Metadata Sync
form.title: Metadata synchronization
form.description: Each metadata contains links to the GeoNetwork's server in order to allow resource retrieval. If you change the server's address and port from the web interface, these links will break. This panel simply scans all metadata and fixes these links.
form.precon: All local metadata must be scanned and changed so there must not be records under editing.

form.label: Import
form.title: Metadata import
form.description: This panel lets you reimport a previouly exported set of metadata/data. The import is not destructive, in the sense that new records will be created. So, make sure to have an empty database if you don't want metadata overlap.
form.precon: Use MEF facilities so GeoNetwork must be running.

form.label: Export
form.title: Metadata export
form.description: This panel lets you export your metadata/data from GeoNetwork into a folder of your file system. There will be one file for each metadata/data in MEF format.
form.precon: Use MEF facilities so GeoNetwork must be running.

form.label: Setup
form.title: Database setup
form.description: Once you have configured your DBMS in the 'configuration/dbms' panel, you have to use this panel to create tables and fill them with initial data.
form.precon: Obviously GeoNetwork cannot be running while the database gets built.

form.label: Data files
form.title: Create data files
form.description: The purpose of this panel is to create the data files of the embedded database. You don't have to mess with this because the installer already creates these files. You only need this facility when you get GeoNetwork from the subversion repository. In this case you have to create the data files before running the setup panel.
form.precon: Obviously GeoNetwork cannot be running while the database gets built.
